data.sponsors-Ô∏è#Sponsors ‚ù§Ô∏è: If you are enjoying some of my OSS guides or libs for your company, I'd really appreciate a sponsorship, a coffee or a dropped star. That gives me a tasty morning boost and help me to make some of my ideas come true üôè

data.features#Features:
üëâ¬† Typeguards and assertions with a consistent style.
üëâ¬† Assertions with useful default error message.
üëâ¬† Return weak opaque types for boolean, strings and numbers.
üëâ¬† Optimized tree-shakability, starts at 56b.
üëâ¬† Don't leak values in the default assertion error messages.
üëâ¬† No deps. Node, browser and edge support.
data.install#Install:
yarn add @httpx/assert
pnpm add @httpx/assert
npm install @httpx/assert
data.documentation#Documentation: üëâ Official website, GitHub Readme or generated api doc
data.consistent-style#Consistent style: Typeguards starts with isXXX and have an assertion counterpart named assertXXX.isParsableXXX and assertParsableXXX denotes a string.
data.isplainobject#isPlainObject:
Name	Type	Comment	isPlainObject<T?>	PlainObject		assertPlainObject<T?>	PlainObject		
Inspired and compatible with is-plain-obj. Check the test file
import { isPlainObject, assertPlainObject } from '@httpx/assert';
// Simple case: without generic value
isPlainObject({ });                     // üëà ‚úÖ true
isPlainObject({ key: 'value' });        // üëà ‚úÖ true
isPlainObject({ key: new Date() });     // üëà ‚úÖ true
isPlainObject(new Object());            // üëà ‚úÖ true
isPlainObject(Object.create(null));     // üëà ‚úÖ true
isPlainObject({nested: { key: true} }); // üëà ‚úÖ true
isPlainObject(runInNewContext('({})')); // üëà ‚úÖ true
class Test { };
isPlainObject(new Test())               // üëà ‚ùå false
isPlainObject(10);                      // üëà ‚ùå false
isPlainObject(null);                    // üëà ‚ùå false
isPlainObject('hello');                 // üëà ‚ùå false
isPlainObject([]);                      // üëà ‚ùå false
isPlainObject(new Date());              // üëà ‚ùå false
isPlainObject(Math);                    // üëà ‚ùå false
// (... see test file)
assertPlainObject({})                  // üëà ‚úÖ true
data.isnumbersafeint#isNumberSafeInt:
import { assertNumberSafeInt, isNumberSafeInt } from '@httpx/assert';
isNumberSafeInt(10n); // üëâ false
isNumberSafeInt(BigInt(10)); // üëâ false
isNumberSafeInt(Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER); // üëâ true
assertNumberSafeInt(Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER + 1); // üëâ throws
data.arraynonempty#ArrayNonEmpty:
Name	Type	Opaque type	Comment	isArrayNonEmpty	unknown[]	ArrayNonEmpty		assertArrayNonEmpty	unknown[]	ArrayNonEmpty		
import { isArrayNonEmpty, assertArrayNonEmpty, type ArrayNonEmpty } from '@httpx/assert';
isArrayNonEmpty([]) // üëâ false
isArrayNonEmpty([0,1]) // üëâ true
isArrayNonEmpty([null]) // üëâ true
assertArrayNonEmpty([]) // üëâ throws
data.stringnonempty#StringNonEmpty:
Name	Type	Opaque type	Comment	isStringNonEmpty	string	StringNonEmpty	Trims the value	assertStringNonEmpty	string	StringNonEmpty	Trims the value	
import { assertStringNonEmpty, isStringNonEmpty, type StringNonEmpty } from '@httpx/assert';
isStringNonEmpty(''); // üëâ false
isStringNonEmpty(' '); // üëâ false: trim by default
assertStringNonEmpty(''); // üëâ throws
data.parsablesafeint#ParsableSafeInt:
Name	Type	Opaque type	Comment	isParsableSafeInt	string	ParsableSafeInt		assertParsableSafeInt	string	ParsableSafeInt		
import { assertParsableSafeInt, isParsableSafeInt } from '@httpx/assert';
isParsableSafeInt(2); // üëâ false
isParsableSafeInt(`${Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER}`); // üëâ true
assertParsableSafeInt(`${Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER}1`); // üëâ throws
data.bundle-size#Bundle size:
Code and bundler have been tuned to target a minimal compressed footprint
for the browser.ESM individual imports are tracked by a
size-limit configuration.
Scenario	Size (compressed)	Import isPlainObject	~ 100b	Import isUuid	~ 175b	Import isEan13	~ 117b	All typeguards, assertions and helpers	~ 1700b	
For CJS usage (not recommended) track the size on bundlephobia.
data.compatibility#Compatibility:
Level	CI	Description	Node	‚úÖ	CI for 18.x, 20.x & 22.x.	Browsers	‚úÖ	> 95% on 12/2023. Mins to Chrome 96+, Firefox 90+, Edge 19+, iOS 12+, Safari 12+, Opera 77+	Edge	‚úÖ	Ensured on CI with @vercel/edge-runtime.	Typescript	‚úÖ	TS 5.0+ / are-the-type-wrong checks on CI.	ES2022	‚úÖ	Dist files checked with es-check	
For older browsers: most frontend frameworks can transpile the library (ie: nextjs...)

data: DSN & JDBC string parser with query params support in a light and modern package.
data.features#Features:
üëâ¬† Parse individual fields (ie: driver, user, password, host...)
üññ¬† Handle query string parameters and converts to boolean and numeric values.
ü¶Ñ¬† Handle special characters like /, :... in the password (some libs won't).
üöÄ¬† Error with indicative message / reasons (discriminated union or throwable).
üõ°Ô∏è¬† Don't leak passwords in the error message.
üôè¬† Assertion and typeguard helpers
ü§ó¬† Ecosystem friendly (ie: zod integration).
data.install#Install:
yarn add @httpx/dsn-parser
pnpm add @httpx/dsn-parser
npm install @httpx/dsn-parser
data.portability#Portability: parseDsn won't make any assumptions on default values (i.e: default port for mysql...).
data.why--in-password-matters#Why '/' in pass:
Some libs (ioredis...) still might fail parsing a password containing '/',
unfortunately they're pretty convenient, i.e:
openssl rand 60 | openssl base64 -A
# YFUXIG9INIK7dFyE9aXtxLmjmnYL0zv6YluBJJbC6alKIBema/MwEGy3VUpx0oLAvWHUFGFMagAdLxrB
data.compatibility#Compatibility:
Level	CI	Description	Node	‚úÖ	CI for 18.x, 20.x & 22.x.	Browsers	‚úÖ	> 95% on 12/2023. Mins to Chrome 96+, Firefox 90+, Edge 19+, iOS 12+, Safari 12+, Opera 77+	Edge	‚úÖ	Ensured on CI with @vercel/edge-runtime.	Typescript	‚úÖ	TS 5.0 + / are-the-type-wrong checks on CI.	ES2022	‚úÖ	Dist files checked with es-check	
For older browsers: most frontend frameworks can transpile the library (ie: nextjs...)

data:
HTTP status errors with default message, instanceof, stack and nested error cause support.
Lightweight, typical usage between 500b and 1300b.
Includes convenience typeguards, optional contextual info and a built-in serializer
to cover cross-environments challenges (RSC, SSR...).
data.quick-start#Quick start:
yarn add @httpx/exception
pnpm add @httpx/exception
npm install @httpx/exception
data.features#Features:
üëâ¬† Usage by explicit named imports and/or status code.
üëâ¬† If message not provided, defaults to http error message
üëâ¬† Supports pre-defined contextual information.
üëâ¬† Built-in serializer to allow cross-env uses (ssr, rsc, superjson, logs...).
üëâ¬† Supports nested error through native Error.cause support.
üëâ¬† Extends native Error class with stacktrace support.
üëâ¬† No deps. Node, edge and modern browsers compatibility,
data.parameters#Parameters:
Http exceptions and createHttpException accept a parameter of type string | HttpExceptionParams. If no parameter
is provided the default message is used.
data.serializer#Serializer:
Exceptions can be (de-)serialized to json or other formats. Use cases varies from
ssr-frameworks (ie: nextjs getServerSideProps)
/ loggers (sentry, winston...).Nested error causes are supported but ignored if not supported by
the runtime.Additionally, you can pass any native errors (Error, EvalError, RangeError, ReferenceError,
SyntaxError, TypeError, URIError) as well as a custom one (the later will be transformed to the base type Error).‚ö†Ô∏è Since v3.0.0:For security reasons stack traces
won't be serialized anymore by default as they might contain sensitive information in production. To opt-in selectively
for stack traces serialization (ie: development or logging)
convertToSerializable, createFromSerializable, toJson and fromJson functions
accepts a SerializerParams.includeStack param as second argument.
data.default-messages#Default messages:
Messages are inferred from the Http exception class name. They are
compatible with the popular statuses package.
Status	Class	Message	400	HttpBadRequest	Bad request	401	HttpUnauthorized	Unauthorized	402	HttpPaymentRequired	Payment required	403	HttpForbidden	Forbidden	404	HttpNotFound	Not found	405	HttpMethodNotAllowed	Method not allowed	406	HttpNotAcceptable	Not acceptable	407	HttpProxyAuthenticationRequired	...	408	HttpRequestTimeout	...	409	HttpConflict	...	410	HttpGone	...	411	HttpLengthRequired	...	412	HttpPreConditionFailed	...	413	HttpPayloadTooLarge	...	414	HttpUriTooLong	...	415	HttpUnsupportedMediaType	...	416	HttpRangeNotSatisfiable	...	417	HttpExpectationFailed	...	418	HttpImATeapot	...	421	HttpMisdirectedRequest	...	422	HttpUnprocessableEntity	...	423	HttpLocked	...	424	HttpFailedDependency	...	425	HttpTooEarly	...	426	HttpUpgradeRequired	...	428	HttpPreconditionFailed	...	429	HttpTooManyRequests	...	431	HttpRequestHeaderFieldsTooLarge	...	451	HttpUnavailableForLegalReasons	...	
Server http status error code
Status	Class	Message	500	HttpInternalServerError	Internal server error	501	HttpNotImplemented	...	502	HttpBadGateway	...	503	HttpServiceUnavailable	...	504	HttpGatewayTimeout	...	505	HttpVersionNotSupported	...	506	HttpVariantAlsoNegotiates	...	507	HttpInsufficientStorage	...	508	HttpLoopDetected	...	510	HttpNotExtended	...	511	HttpNetwordAuthenticationRequired	...
data.compatibility#Compatibility:
Level	CI	Description	Node	‚úÖ	CI for 18.x, 20.x & 22.x.	Browsers	‚úÖ	> 93% on 12/2023. Chrome 96+, Firefox 90+, Edge 19+, ios 15+, Safari 15+ and Opera 77+	Edge	‚úÖ	Ensured on CI with @vercel/edge-runtime.	Typescript	‚úÖ	TS 4.7+ / are-the-type-wrong checks on CI.	ES2022	‚úÖ	Dist files checked with es-check	
For older browsers:
üëâ Most frontend frameworks can transpile the library (ie: nextjs...)
üëâ You might want to add the error-cause-polyfill to support
nested errors (if not present they are simply discarded - no runtime errors).
data.bundle-size#Bundle size:
Code and bundler have been tuned to target a minimal compressed footprint
for the browser. In ESM, typical usage the bundle size will vary between 500b to 1300b compressed
(including default messages for the 43 status codes).ESM individual imports are tracked by a
size-limit configuration.
Scenario	Size (compressed)	Import generic exception (HttpClientException)	~ 390b	Import 1 client exception	~ 425b	Import 2 client exceptions	~ 447b	Import 6 client exceptions	~ 515b	Import createHttpException (all 43 exceptions)	~ 1240b	Import fromJson (incl all + createHttpException)	~ 1740b	All serializer functions + exceptions + typeguards	~ 1950b	
For CJS usage (not recommended) track the size on bundlephobia.
data.packaging#Packaging:
This library offers a dual cjs/esm bundle. The (optional) serializer code has been tuned to
avoid issues with dual package hazards.The export fields and the builds are checked on the CI with are-the-types-wrong.
PS: Plans to remove cjs support might land in a next major version.
data.typescript#Typescript:
This library targets typescript 5+ with descriptions (see
the generated api docs).
data.upgrade#Upgrade:
Refer to the UPGRADE.md for detailed information.
Version	Comment	3.x	Serializer functions don't include stack by default	2.x	Node 18.x, modern browsers (see how to transpile)

data:
Fast and lightweight (~80B) functions to check or assert
that a value is a plain object.A plain object is a basic JavaScript object, such as {}, { data: [] }, new Object() or Object.create(null).See how it compares to other libraries.
data.install#Install:
yarn add @httpx/plain-object
pnpm add @httpx/plain-object
npm install @httpx/plain-object
data.features#Features:
üëâ¬† Provide isPlainObject and assertPlainObject functions.
ü¶Ñ¬† Convenience PlainObject typescript typings.
üöÄ¬† Faster than most alternatives, see benchmarks.
üìê¬† Lightweight (starts at ~80B)
üõ°Ô∏è¬† Tested on node 18-22, browser, cloudflare workers and runtime/edge.
üôè¬† Works cross-realms (node:vm runInNewContext,...)
üóùÔ∏è¬† Available in ESM and CJS formats.
data.isplainobject#isPlainObject:
import { isPlainObject } from '@httpx/plain-object';
// ‚úÖüëá True
isPlainObject({ });                       // ‚úÖ
isPlainObject({ key: 'value' });          // ‚úÖ
isPlainObject({ key: new Date() });       // ‚úÖ
isPlainObject(new Object());              // ‚úÖ
isPlainObject(Object.create(null));       // ‚úÖ
isPlainObject({ nested: { key: true} });  // ‚úÖ
isPlainObject(new Proxy({}, {}));         // ‚úÖ
isPlainObject({ [Symbol('tag')]: 'A' });  // ‚úÖ
// ‚úÖüëá (node context, workers, ...)
const runInNewContext = await import('node:vm').then(
    (mod) => mod.runInNewContext
);
isPlainObject(runInNewContext('({})'));   // ‚úÖ
// ‚úÖüëá Static built-in classes are treated as plain objects
//       check for `isStaticBuiltInClass` to exclude if needed
isPlainObject(Math);                // ‚úÖ
isPlainObject(JSON);                // ‚úÖ
isPlainObject(Atomics);             // ‚úÖ
// ‚ùåüëá False
class Test { };
isPlainObject(new Test())           // ‚ùå
isPlainObject(10);                  // ‚ùå
isPlainObject(null);                // ‚ùå
isPlainObject('hello');             // ‚ùå
isPlainObject([]);                  // ‚ùå
isPlainObject(new Date());          // ‚ùå
isPlainObject(new Uint8Array([1])); // ‚ùå
isPlainObject(Buffer.from('ABC'));  // ‚ùå
isPlainObject(Promise.resolve({})); // ‚ùå
isPlainObject(Object.create({}));   // ‚ùå
isPlainObject(new (class Cls {}));  // ‚ùå
isPlainObject(globalThis);          // ‚ùå,

data.sindresorhusis-plain-obj#@sindresorhus/i:
This library wouldn't be possible without @sindresorhus is-plain-obj.
Notable differences:
Slightly faster (10%)
ESM and CJS formats.
Named export.
Smaller bundle size.
Provide a PlainObject type and assertPlainObject function.
Typescript convenience PlainObject type.
Since v2, it diverges from is-plain-obj by
Static built-in classes are considered as plain objects (use isStaticBuiltInClass to exclude).
[Symbol.iterator] is considered as a valid property for plain objects.
[Symbol.toStringTag] is considered as a valid property for plain objects.`
